Downward-facing dog and warrior II are excellent poses to focus on, and improving flexibility in your hips and legs will definitely help you deepen into these poses. Here are some tips to modify these poses, as well as exercises you can do outside of yoga class to improve flexibility in your hips and legs:

**Modifying Downward-Facing Dog:**

1. **Bend your knees**: If your hamstrings or calves are tight, bend your knees slightly to reduce the strain on your lower legs.
2. **Use blocks or straps**: Place blocks under your hands or use straps to deepen the stretch in your shoulders and chest.
3. **Walk your hands forward**: Instead of keeping your hands directly under your shoulders, walk them forward a few inches to reduce the stretch in your shoulders and focus on your hips and legs.
4. **Lift your heels**: Lift your heels off the ground and balance on your toes to engage your calf muscles and stretch your Achilles tendons.

**Modifying Warrior II:**

1. **Shorten your stance**: Take a shorter stance to reduce the stretch in your hips and legs.
2. **Turn your back foot slightly**: Turn your back foot slightly inward to reduce the stretch in your hip and groin area.
3. **Bend your front knee**: Bend your front knee more deeply to reduce the stretch in your back leg and hip.
4. **Use blocks or straps**: Place blocks under your hands or use straps to deepen the stretch in your chest and shoulders.

**Exercises outside of yoga class:**

1. **Hip circles**: Stand with your feet hip-width apart and your hands on your hips. Move your hips in large circles, first clockwise and then counterclockwise. Repeat for 5-10 repetitions.
2. **Leg swings**: Stand with your feet hip-width apart and swing one leg forward and backward, then switch to the other leg. Repeat for 10-15 repetitions on each leg.
3. **Glute bridges**: Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground. Lift your hips up towards the ceiling, squeezing your glutes at the top, and then lower back down. Repeat for 10-15 repetitions.
4. **Calf raises**: Stand on the edge of a stair or step with your heels hanging off the edge. Raise up onto your tiptoes and then lower back down. Repeat for 10-15 repetitions.
5. **Lying hamstring stretch**: Lie on your back with your legs straight and lift one leg up towards the ceiling. Hold for 10-15 seconds and then lower back down. Repeat on the other side.

**Tips for improving flexibility:**

1. **Hold stretches longer**: Hold each stretch for 20-30 seconds to allow your muscles to relax and lengthen.
2. **Stretch regularly**: Stretch 2-3 times a week, ideally after a warm-up or workout, to improve flexibility.
3. **Focus on slow, controlled movements**: Move slowly and controlledly into each stretch to avoid bouncing or forcing your muscles beyond their comfortable range.
4. **Breathe deeply**: Breathe deeply and slowly while stretching to help your muscles relax and lengthen.

Remember to be patient and consistent with your stretching practice, and you'll start to notice improvements in your flexibility and range of motion over time.
